channel.title: ai on Cho-Nan Tsai CTO media interviews, essays and talks
channel.description: Recent content in ai on Cho-Nan Tsai CTO media interviews, essays and talks

item.title: I used AI to create this music track
item.description: I don’t know any musical instrument or how to read a score. I never had any type of music education. I may even be a bit tone deaf. So I just went to an AI program and clicked a button. And, this came out. I thought this may be good enough for the music to a game trailer. voilà.

item.title: A smarter crosswalk
item.description: Crosswalks have been around a long time but they don’t ever change. I closely observed one today. There is a sign that says ‘Push button for Pedestrian Crossing’. And then, there is a countdown signal forever pestering people to walk faster. I think this is very dated. With Tesla able to autopilot itself today, I am sure the technology exists for sensors and cameras to detect the presence of pedestrians.

item.title: AI drew Steve Jobs eating sushi
item.description: Today I use an AI tool to draw a picture of Steve Jobs eating sushi. This is what I got: Remembering what I read in Steve Jobs by Walter Isaacson, Jobs’ favorite food was sushi. Although Jobs had a turbulent relationship with Lisa, he often recounted the good times while eating sushi in Tokyo with his daughter. Trust me, I have tried on a number of different AI image generator sites, including DALL.

item.title: How to (gracefully) jump start data science initiatives at a start-up
item.description: Conference 1 Conference 2 Slides for IDEAS data science talk PPTX Slides for IDEAS data science talk ODP Slides for IDEAS data science talk PDF About the Talk While machine learning and artificial intelligence can deliver a ton of value to businesses, there are still many businesses today struggling to get started with data science initiatives. Do you buy data or collect data? What type of talent to hire to get started on the first project?
